name: Mise-En-Place Personal Productivity System
desc:
Increase your personal productivity each week with this board that Justin Gallagher, one of the creators of Trello, uses every day. Split your work into very specific lists so nothing falls through the cracks. Use the reference list to keep important information on hand. Hold yourself accountable with meeting notes, and most importantly spend some time each morning planning out the day ahead.

**[Read Justin's full post](https://blog.trello.com/work-life-focus-trello-insider-guide-personal-productivity)** on the Trello blog to learn more about his personal productivity methodology.

card.name: How to set up this board: A Trello Insider's Guide To Personal Productivity

listing.name: Card Snooze
listing.description:
If You Snooze You Won’t Lose.

Now you can clean up the clutter of cards you're not going to get to until another day. The Card Snooze Power-Up lets you to snooze a card until a later date and time, when it magically reappears on the board.  Need it sooner? Find your card in "archived" cards.

- Snooze until a specified date and time.
- Card magically reappears. Presto!

![screenshot](https://card-snooze.trello.services/images/Card_Snooze_1.jpg)

![screenshot](https://card-snooze.trello.services/images/Card_Snooze_2.jpg)
listing.overview: Snooze (archive) a card until a certain time, when it will be restored to the board.

listing.name: Zapier
listing.description:
![Zapier](https://cdn.zappy.app/6e1b82a6719e5fb38f11706e21067ed9.png)

Automate repetitive tasks so you can focus on your most important work. [Zapier](https://zapier.com) connects Trello to 6000+ apps, including Google Sheets, Evernote, HubSpot, Facebook and more.

Set up time-saving automations in a few clicks to move info and get things done between all your favorite apps.


###How it works:
![](https://cdn.zappy.app/3ffdccf6d46f3ba0cede6b7861544438.png)

###Click the "Add Power-Up" button at the top of this page to start using Zapier with Trello!
listing.overview: Automate repetitive tasks so you can focus on your most important work. Zapier connects Trello to 1000+ apps.

listing.name: Card Repeater
listing.description:
**Put regular tasks on repeat.**

The Card Repeater Power-Up for Trello automates the creation of Trello cards for repeated tasks, giving you one less thing to have to think about. Simply set the schedule on a card and Trello will automatically make an exact copy of that card at the given date and time. This makes it easy to establish a process for weekly to-dos, retrospectives, end of the month closing out the books, or a reminder to get your mom a birthday present.

- Schedule cards to repeat on a daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly basis.
- Cards will be copied to a specified list automatically.
- Build a process into your workflow and make sure nothing falls through the cracks.

![screenshot](https://recurring-cards.trello.services/images/Card_Repeater_1.jpg)

![screenshot](https://recurring-cards.trello.services/images/Card_Repeater_2.jpg)
listing.overview: Automatically copy Trello cards for repeated tasks to save time and bring process to your workflow.

listing.name: Calendar Power-Up
listing.description:
Bring perspective to due dates with the Calendar Power-Up for Trello. Whether you are planning a conference, managing an editorial calendar, or organizing a family vacation, the Calendar Power-Up let’s you display cards with due dates in a weekly or monthly calendar view. Easily prioritize cards by dragging and dropping them on the calendar to automatically update their due dates, and export your Trello calendar to third party apps with an iCalendar link.

- Display and filter cards with due dates in a weekly or monthly calendar view.

- Manage due dates by dragging and dropping cards on the calendar.

- Easily see completed tasks by marking due dates complete.

- Export a board’s calendar to third party calendars with each board’s unique iCalendar link.

- The Calendar Power-Up is supported on the web and iOS and Android mobile devices.

![screenshot](https://calendar.trello.services/images/Calendar_1.jpg)

![screenshot](https://calendar.trello.services/images/Calendar_2.jpg)

![screenshot](https://calendar.trello.services/images/Calendar_3.jpg)

![screenshot](https://calendar.trello.services/images/Calendar_4.jpg)
listing.overview: Visualize Trello cards in a calendar view.

listing.name: Package Tracker
listing.description:
The Package Tracker Power-Up for Trello powered by [Shippo](https://goshippo.com/) lets you attach tracking numbers right to the back of Trello cards. You’ll see an up-to-date shipping status and expected delivery date on the card front to track your orders. Works with FedEx, USPS, UPS, DHL, and more (incl. international services).

- See shipping status and expected delivery on the card front!
- Works with these domestic carriers: FedEx, USPS, UPS, DHL, and Lasership, and these international carriers: Canada Post, Deutsche Post, GLS Germany, GLS France, Mondial Relay, Newgistics and OnTrac. Some restrictions may apply: https://docs.goshippo.com/docs/tracking/tracking/#carrier-restrictions

![screenshot](https://package-tracker.trello.services/images/screenshots/Package_Tracker_1.jpg)

![screenshot](https://package-tracker.trello.services/images/screenshots/Package_Tracker_2.jpg)
listing.overview: Track packages right from Trello and get always up-to-date info on orders and shipments.

cards.desc: Learn how the original Trello user, Justin Gallagher, uses Trello to increase his personal productivity each week. (Grab his real Trello board template and tips.)
cards.name: How to set up this board: A Trello Insider's Guide To Personal Productivity

cards.desc: All Power-Ups can be activated here: trello.com/power-ups or in your board menu.
cards.name: Power-Ups you can use on this board for maximum productivity.

cards.desc:
**Zapier** is a service that makes it super simple to connect apps and automate workflows. You can set up “Zaps” to import emails, calendar events, and chat messages:

-  Add a card to the Inbox list whenever you flag an email message.
- Create cards in the Tomorrow list for all calendar events 24 hours before they happen.
- Create cards in the Inbox list when you star chat messages in Slack.

Read a detailed instruction setup guide [here](https://blog.trello.com/work-life-focus-trello-insider-guide-personal-productivity).
cards.name: Automation Tips & Tricks: How to funnel all your things into this board.

attachments.name: Full list of Zapier <> Trello integrations

cards.name: M: Meeting cards are always prefixed with "M" and have a due date.
E: Email cards are prefixed with "E" and sent to the board via Zapier.

cards.desc:
First, take each card that represents a meeting and put them in order—earliest to latest. 

Next, look at the time you have outside of meetings and slot in projects based on how important they are and whether they’ll fit into the time available.
cards.name: Spend 5-15 minutes each morning planning out the day ahead. Move cards over from Tomorrow, Soon, Waiting, and Inbox, and add your meetings.
Hold tasks here that won't fit in Today, but should happen soon.

cards.desc: As the week progresses, this list should get shorter and shorter. If it’s not, ask yourself if you're giving undue priority to stuff that pops up unexpectedly.
cards.name: Add tasks here that should happen by the end of the week.
Add stuff here that needs to happen eventually, but hasn't been scheduled yet.
Everything should be added here first, before they've been prioritized into the other lists.
This is your trophy room. It feels good to be reminded of all the things you've accomplished!
This is your place to keep inspiration and things to remember.

checkItems.name: **Automation By Zapier:** Save time organizing tasks by having your emails, calendar events, and chat messages imported to your Inbox automatically.
**Calendar:** The calendar view is great for getting a sense of how things are looking across a week and into next week.
**Card Repeater:** Automatically create cards for tasks that come up at set intervals, like "quarterly report" or "check in with Mom."
**Card Snooze:** If it seems like some tasks won't get tackled in This Week, snooze them until next week!
**Dropbox** and/or **Google Drive:** Keep important files linked to tasks and meeting cards for easy reference.
**Package Tracker:** Keep track of mailed packages and letters, and know when they're delivered right from Trello.
